Toronto's TTC sends out tweets and posts notices in the system if an elevator is down. It works mostly but if you use a wheelchair you have to pay attention.

It's been an hour, where's the petition. We need to start signing it.
;)

Here's an example, I was shown an apartment once that I thought would be a good fit. When I came back to the office to fill out paperwork, I noticed the number they were offering wasn't the same one on the door of the apartment. It wasn't even the same floor. They said I could take it or leave it. This city is full of assholes who like to take advantage of the young. Luckily I had time and could look elsewhere. My gut told me to run, and I did. I walked out and never looked back at that place.
Not everyone is in that position where they can walk away.

When I grew up you were not taught financial management in school. It took an awful lot of research. Sadly there are slum lords out there and jerks who like to take advantage of the youth. This article at least is a good warning.
Sometimes we all make mistakes the hard way.
Have you tried writing for a living?
It's called bait and switch.

TLDR: The landlords in the world are full of shit. Especially Toronto. First time renters get fucked hard.

How old were you when you first looked to live on your own?
Were you prepared?

For those all downvoting and shitting on the author, you've all forgotten about what it's like to move to the big city. Honestly. It's nice to have articles written about this. If this article helps ONE person from dealing with crack house apartments, slumlords, or cockroaches or god forbid bed bugs, then it will have done it's job.
